intro: Virola albidiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered virola, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Myristicaceae and is characterized by its large, glossy leaves and showy white flowers. The tree produces a heavy, aromatic resin that has been used traditionally by indigenous peoples for medicinal and ritual purposes. Its fruit is a woody capsule containing several seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Virola albidiflora plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
